New Records: Paul Skenes recorded his 16th game with seven or more strikeouts, surpassing Larry McWilliams for seventh-most by a Pirates starter in a season.
The Pittsburgh Pirates achieved their 12th shutout of the season.
Key Match Events: Oneil Cruz hit his 21st homer in the first inning.
Nick Yorke hit his first career homer off Fernando Cruz in the fifth inning.
Paul Skenes pitched a dominant game with 9 strikeouts and 2 hits through 5 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Pirates manager Derek Shelton praised Skenes' evolution as a pitcher.
Reds manager David Bell noted Skenes' effective change-up as a key factor.
Reds first baseman Ty France highlighted Skenes' command and execution.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a shutout for the Pirates, their 12th of the season.
Hunter Greene made his first start since being sidelined by elbow soreness.
The Reds lost by shutout for the 14th time this season.
Others: The Pirates and Reds have upcoming games against the Milwaukee Brewers and Cleveland Guardians, respectively.
